      • redirect

        public WebApplicationException redirect(@NotNull
                               URI uri,
                               @NotNull
                               String message,
                               @NotNull
                               Level level)
        Create an exception that will redirect to the page with an error message.

        The difference between this method and a static forward(URI,String,Level) is in its awareness of a resource, which is forwarding. Key benefit is that a non-static method adds extra value to the cookie, which is time consumed by the resource until the redirect happened.

        Parameters:
        uri - The URI to forward to
        message - The message to show as error
        level - Message level
        Returns:
        The exception to throw

      • redirect

        public WebApplicationException redirect(@NotNull
                               URI uri,
                               @NotNull
                               Exception cause)
        Create an exception that will redirect to the page with an error message.

        The difference between this method and a static forward(URI,Exception) is in its awareness of a resource, which is forwarding. Key benefit is that a non-static method adds extra value to the cookie, which is time consumed by the resource until the redirect happened.

        Parameters:
        uri - The URI to forward to
        cause - The cause of this problem
        Returns:
        The exception to throw
